intro: Koellia huronensis, commonly known as Huron's koellia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Great Lakes region of North America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white to yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along the shores of lakes and rivers. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for pollinators. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
